On October 4, 2007, [[openSUSE | openSUSE]] 10.3 became the first major distribution to ship with Compiz Fusion.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://news.opensuse.org/2007/10/04/announcing-opensuse-103-gm/ | title=openSUSE 10.3 Release | author=Francis Giannaros | date=Thursday, October 4th, 2007 | work=openSUSE News | accessdate=2008-01-01}}</ref>
On October 4, 2007, [[openSUSE | openSUSE]] 10.3 became the first major distribution to ship with Compiz Fusion.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://news.opensuse.org/2007/10/04/announcing-opensuse-103-gm/ | title=openSUSE 10.3 Release | author=Francis Giannaros | date=Thursday, October 4th, 2007 | work=openSUSE News | accessdate=2008-01-01}}</ref>

On October 18, 2007 [[Ubuntu (Linux distribution) | Ubuntu]] 7.10 followed by using Compiz Fusion as the default window manager on supported hardware.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.ubuntu.com/news/ubuntu-desktop710 | title=Canonical Launches Latest Ubuntu Desktop | author=Ubuntu and Canonical | date=Monday, October 15th, 2007 | work=Ubuntu News | accessdate=2008-01-01}}</ref>
